main event: On 10 May 1960, a meteor-like object with a red head and bluish-white tail was observed for about 3 seconds over the WSW of Hawaiian Islands.
interesting points: The object was described as having a size with the head and tail being the same width., It diminished in brilliance until it disappeared., The sighting was confirmed by approximately 25 persons., The duration of the sighting was very brief, lasting only 5 seconds., The description was typical of a meteor, according to comments in the report.
witness description: Descriptions agree, resembled a slow-moving shooting star, perhaps a satellite entering atmosphere
